body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0134__main__33"/> To Victor Fankenstein <lb n="c57-0134__main__34"/>May<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0134__main__d3e25369"/>Feb.<del eID="c57-0134__main__d3e25369"/> 18 – 17— <lb n="c57-0134__main__35"/> My dearest Friend.<lb n="c57-0135__main__1"/> It gave me the greatest pleasure to <lb n="c57-0135__main__2"/> receive a letter from my Uncle dated at <lb n="c57-0135__main__3"/> Paris. You are no longer at a formi<mdel>t</mdel>dable <lb n="c57-0135__main__4"/> distance and I may hope to see you in <lb n="c57-0135__main__5"/> less than a fortnight. My poor Cousin!<lb n="c57-0135__main__6"/> How much must you have suffered! <lb n="c57-0135__main__7"/> I expect to see you looking even more <lb n="c57-0135__main__8"/> ill than when you quitted Geneva. This <lb n="c57-0135__main__9"/> winter has been passed most miserably <lb n="c57-0135__main__10"/> but although happiness will not shine <lb n="c57-0135__main__11"/> in our eyes for many months yet I <lb n="c57-0135__main__12"/> hope to <metamark>^</metamark>see peace in your countenance & to <lb n="c57-0135__main__13"/> find that your heart is not totally <lb n="c57-0135__main__14"/> devoid of comfort & tranquility.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0135__main__15"/> Yet I fear that<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0135__main__d3e25448"/>,<del eID="c57-0135__main__d3e25448"/> the same feelings <lb n="c57-0135__main__16"/> now exist that made you so miserable <lb n="c57-0135__main__17"/> a year ago even perhaps augmented by time. <lb n="c57-0135__main__18"/> I would not at this period disturb you <lb n="c57-0135__main__19"/> when so many misfortunes weigh upon <lb n="c57-0135__main__20"/> you but a conversation that I had <lb n="c57-0135__main__21"/> with my uncle previous to his departure <lb n="c57-0135__main__22"/> renders some explanation necessary <lb n="c57-0135__main__23"/> before we meet.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0135__main__24"/> Explanation, you may possibly say, <lb n="c57-0135__main__25"/> what can Elizabeth have to explain? <lb n="c57-0135__main__26"/> If you really say this my questions are <lb n="c57-0135__main__27"/> answered and I have no more to do than <lb n="c57-0135__main__28"/> to sign myself your affectionate cousin. <lb n="c57-0135__main__29"/> But you are distant from me &I can <lb n="c57-0135__main__30"/> not it is possible that you may dread &<lb n="c57-0135__main__31"/> yet be pleased with this explanation <lb n="c57-0135__main__32"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0135__main__d3e25495"/>af<del eID="c57-0135__main__d3e25495"/>and if such could be the case I <lb n="c57-0135__main__33"/> cannot delay it and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0135__main__d3e25506"/>with<del eID="c57-0135__main__d3e25506"/>in<mdel>a</mdel>the probability of <lb n="c57-0135__main__34"/> this being the case I dare not postpone <lb n="c57-0135__main__35"/> any longer to write what during your <lb n="c57-0135__main__36"/> absence I have often wished to express to<lb n="c57-0136__main__1"/> to you but have never had courage to begin.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__2"/> You <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>well know, Victor, that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25559"/>it<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25559"/> our union <lb n="c57-0136__main__3"/> had been the favourite plan of my aunt <lb n="c57-0136__main__4"/> and uncle ever since our infancy–We were <lb n="c57-0136__main__5"/> told this when young and taught to look <lb n="c57-0136__main__6"/> forward to it as an event that would <lb n="c57-0136__main__7"/> certainly take place. We were affectionate <lb n="c57-0136__main__8"/> playfellows during childhood & I beli<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>eve <lb n="c57-0136__main__9"/> dear &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25594"/>beloved<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25594"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>valued friends to one another when <lb n="c57-0136__main__10"/> we grew older. But as a brother & sister <lb n="c57-0136__main__11"/> often entertain a lively affection towards <lb n="c57-0136__main__12"/> one another <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>without desiring a more intimate union may not <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25628"/>this<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25628"/>such also be <lb n="c57-0136__main__13"/> our case. Tell me, dearest Victor, Answer <lb n="c57-0136__main__14"/> me, I conjure you by our mutual happi<lb n="c57-0136__main__15"/>ness, with simple truth do you not love <lb n="c57-0136__main__16"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25651"/>as you would wish to love a wife<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25651"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__17"/> another?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__18"/> You have travelled, you have spent <lb n="c57-0136__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25665"/>some<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25665"/><lb n="c57-0136__left_margin__1"/>several years of you<mdel>ng</mdel>r life at Ingolstadt–&<lb n="c57-0136__main__20"/> I confess to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25691"/>m<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25691"/> you, my friend that when <lb n="c57-0136__main__21"/> I saw you last Autumn so unhappy <lb n="c57-0136__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25698"/>& obstinately<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25698"/> flying from the society <lb n="c57-0136__main__23"/> of every creature to solitude &despon<lb n="c57-0136__main__24"/>dency I could not help supposing <lb n="c57-0136__main__25"/> that you might regret our connection <lb n="c57-0136__main__26"/>& believe your self bound in honour <lb n="c57-0136__main__27"/> to fulfil the wishes of your parents <lb n="c57-0136__main__28"/> although they opposed themselves to <lb n="c57-0136__main__29"/> your inclinations. But this is false <lb n="c57-0136__main__30"/> resoning. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25723"/>I lo<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25723"/> I confess to you my <lb n="c57-0136__main__31"/> cousin that I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0136__main__d3e25732"/>have<del eID="c57-0136__main__d3e25732"/> love you &<lb n="c57-0136__main__32"/> that in my airy castles of futurity <lb n="c57-0136__main__33"/> you have been my constant friend<lb n="c57-0137__main__1"/> and companion. But it is your hap<lb n="c57-0137__main__2"/>piness I desire as well as my own <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0137__main__d3e25756"/>felicity<del eID="c57-0137__main__d3e25756"/><lb n="c57-0137__main__3"/> when I declare to you that our marriage <lb n="c57-0137__main__4"/> would render me eternally miserable <lb n="c57-0137__main__5"/> unless it were the dictate of your own <lb n="c57-0137__main__6"/> free choice. Even now I weep when I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0137__main__d3e25768"/>co<del eID="c57-0137__main__d3e25768"/> think <lb n="c57-0137__main__7"/> that borne down as you are by the <lb n="c57-0137__main__8"/> cruellest misfortunes you may stifle <lb n="c57-0137__main__9"/> by the word honor all hope of that <lb n="c57-0137__main__10"/> love & happiness which would alone <lb n="c57-0137__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0137__main__d3e25784"/>conduce to your felicity<del eID="c57-0137__main__d3e25784"/><mdel>.</mdel>restore you to yourself. I who have <lb n="c57-0137__main__12"/> so disinterrested an affection for you <lb n="c57-0137__main__13"/> may encrease your miseries tenfold <lb n="c57-0137__main__14"/> by being an obstacle to your wishes <lb n="c57-0137__main__15"/> Ah Victor be assured that yourcou<lb n="c57-0137__main__16"/>sin& playmate has too sincere <lb n="c57-0137__main__17"/> a love for you not to be made <lb n="c57-0137__main__18"/> wretched by this supposition. Be hap<lb n="c57-0137__main__19"/>py my friend and if you obey me in <lb n="c57-0137__main__20"/> this one request be assured that <lb n="c57-0137__main__21"/> nothing on earth will have the power <lb n="c57-0137__main__22"/> to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0137__main__d3e25832"/>disturb.<del eID="c57-0137__main__d3e25832"/><metamark>^</metamark>interrupt my tranquillity.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0137__main__23"/> Do not let this letter disturb you. <lb n="c57-0137__main__24"/> Do <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0137__main__d3e25852"/>y<del eID="c57-0137__main__d3e25852"/> not answer it tomorrow or the <lb n="c57-0137__main__25"/> next day or not even untill you <lb n="c57-0137__main__26"/> come if it will give you pain. My <lb n="c57-0137__main__27"/> Uncle will send me news of your <lb n="c57-0137__main__28"/> health and if I see but one smile <lb n="c57-0137__main__29"/> on your lips when we meet occa<lb n="c57-0137__main__30"/>sioned by this letter or any other <lb n="c57-0137__main__31"/> exertion of mine I shall need no <lb n="c57-0137__main__32"/> other happiness– Your affectionate friend <lb n="c57-0137__main__33"/> Elizabeth Lavenza. <lb n="c57-0137__main__34"/> Geneva<lb n="c57-0138__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0138.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 16<lb n="c57-0138__main__2"/> This letter revived in my memory what I had before <lb n="c57-0138__main__3"/> forgotten, the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0138__main__d3e25900"/>mi<del eID="c57-0138__main__d3e25900"/> threat of fiend when he visited <lb n="c57-0138__main__4"/> me at the Orkney Island. <shi rend="underline">I will be with you</shi><lb n="c57-0138__main__5"/><shi rend="underline">on your marriage night</shi>. Such was my sentence <lb n="c57-0138__main__6"/> and on that night would the dæmon <lb n="c57-0138__main__7"/> e<mdel>n</mdel>mploy every art to destroy me & tear me <lb n="c57-0138__main__8"/> from the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>glimse happiness <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0138__main__d3e25946"/>that might<del eID="c57-0138__main__d3e25946"/><mdel>c</mdel>by which it promised partly <lb n="c57-0138__main__9"/> console my sufferings. On that night he <lb n="c57-0138__main__10"/> had determined to consummate his crimes <lb n="c57-0138__main__11"/> by my death. Well be it so. A deadly struggle <lb n="c57-0138__main__12"/> would then assuredly take place where <lb n="c57-0138__main__13"/> if he was victorious I should be at peace <lb n="c57-0138__main__14"/> and his power over me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0138__main__d3e25975"/>was<del eID="c57-0138__main__d3e25975"/>be at an end <lb n="c57-0138__main__15"/> If he were vanquished he should I <lb n="c57-0138__main__16"/> and I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>should be a free man — Alas what a <lb n="c57-0138__main__17"/> freedom such as peasant endures <lb n="c57-0138__main__18"/> when his family have been massacred <lb n="c57-0138__main__19"/> before his eyes his cottage burnt his <lb n="c57-0138__main__20"/> lands laid waste & he is turned adrift <lb n="c57-0138__main__21"/> homeless, pennyless & alone: but free. <lb n="c57-0138__main__22"/> Such would be my liberty except that <lb n="c57-0138__main__23"/> in my Elizabeth I possessed a treasure <lb n="c57-0138__main__24"/> alas balanced by the horrors of remorse <lb n="c57-0138__main__25"/>& guilt which would pursue me <lb n="c57-0138__main__26"/> untill death.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0138__main__27"/> Sweet & beloved Elizabeth! I read <lb n="c57-0138__main__28"/>& reread her letter & some softened <lb n="c57-0138__main__29"/> feelings stole in to my heart & dared <lb n="c57-0138__main__30"/> whisper Paradiscical dreams of love <lb n="c57-0138__main__31"/>& joy– But the apple was already <lb n="c57-0138__main__32"/> eaten & the Angels arm bared ready <lb n="c57-0138__main__33"/> to chase me from all hope. Yet I<lb n="c57-0139__main__1"/> would die to make her happy <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26055"/>on whom I<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26055"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__2"/> and if the monster ex<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26060"/>c<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26060"/>ecuted his threat die <lb n="c57-0139__main__3"/> I must.<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__1"/> death was <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__2"/> inevitable. Yet again I considered <mdel>if</mdel>whether my marriage <lb n="c57-0139__main__4"/> would hasten my fate if once the fiend had <lb n="c57-0139__main__5"/> determined on my death – It might indeed <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26111"/>protract<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26111"/> hasten a <lb n="c57-0139__main__6"/> few months but if he suspected that I delayed <lb n="c57-0139__main__7"/> it on his account he would certainly revenge <lb n="c57-0139__main__8"/> himself some other way<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__1"/> My destruction <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__2"/> might inded <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__3"/> arrive a few <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__4"/> months sooner <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__5"/> but if my <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__6"/> torturer should <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__7"/> suspect that <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__8"/> I postponed <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__9"/> my marriage <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__10"/> on account of <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__11"/> his menaces <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__12"/> he would surely <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__13"/> find other, &<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__14"/> perhaps more <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__15"/> dreadful means <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__16"/> of revenge. He had vowed <shi rend="underline">to</shi><lb n="c57-0139__main__9"/><shi rend="underline">be with me on my marriage night</shi> Yet he <lb n="c57-0139__main__10"/> did not consider that threat as binding <lb n="c57-0139__main__11"/> him to peace in the mean time – for as <lb n="c57-0139__main__12"/> if to shew me that he was not yet <lb n="c57-0139__main__13"/> satiated with blood <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26189"/>his ne<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26189"/> he had mur<lb n="c57-0139__main__14"/>dered Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval immediately after the enunciation of his theats – After many hours spent <lb n="c57-0139__main__15"/> in reverie & consideration.. I resolved therefore<lb n="c57-0139__main__16"/> that if <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26228"/>th<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26228"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26234"/>the<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26234"/>my immediate union with <lb n="c57-0139__main__17"/> my cousin s<mdel>h</mdel>would conduce either to hers or <lb n="c57-0139__main__18"/> my fathers happiness my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26254"/>threatened<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26254"/>adver<lb n="c57-0139__main__19"/>sary's threats against my life should <lb n="c57-0139__main__20"/> not retard it a single hour.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__21"/>We returned to Geneva. Elizabeth <lb n="c57-0139__main__22"/> welcome In this state of mind I wrote <lb n="c57-0139__main__23"/> to Elizabeth. My letter was calm and affectio<lb n="c57-0139__main__24"/>nate – I fear, my beloved girl, I said, <lb n="c57-0139__main__25"/> little happiness remains on earth for <lb n="c57-0139__main__26"/> us, yet <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26292"/>what<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26292"/>all that I may one day enjoy <lb n="c57-0139__main__27"/> is <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26301"/>all<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26301"/> concentered in you. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26308"/>my beloved one<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26308"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__28"/> Chase away your idle fears –To you <lb n="c57-0139__main__29"/> alone do I consecrate my life & my <lb n="c57-0139__main__30"/> endeavours for <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0139__main__d3e26317"/>h<del eID="c57-0139__main__d3e26317"/> content. I have <lb n="c57-0139__main__31"/> one secret, Elizabeth, a dreadful one— <lb n="c57-0139__main__32"/> It will chill your frame with horror <lb n="c57-0139__main__33"/> and then far from being surprised at<lb n="c57-0140__main__1"/> at my misery you will only wonder that I live. <lb n="c57-0140__main__2"/> I will reveal this tale of misery & terror <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26342"/>th<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26342"/> to <lb n="c57-0140__main__3"/> you the day after our marriage – for, my <lb n="c57-0140__main__4"/> sweet cousin, we must have perfect confi<lb n="c57-0140__main__5"/>dence between us – But untill then I conjure <lb n="c57-0140__main__6"/> you do not mention or allude to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26358"/><del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26358"/> it. This <lb n="c57-0140__main__7"/> I most <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26369"/>erne<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26369"/> earnestly entreat of you&<lb n="c57-0140__main__8"/> I know that you will comply.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0140__main__9"/> In about a week after <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26383"/>this<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26383"/>the arrival of Elizabeths letter<lb n="c57-0140__main__10"/> we returned to Geneva. Elizabeth wel<lb n="c57-0140__main__11"/>comed me with warm affection – yet <lb n="c57-0140__main__12"/> tears were in her eyes as she beheld <lb n="c57-0140__main__13"/> my ematiated frame & feverish <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26406"/>eyes<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26406"/>cheeks. I <lb n="c57-0140__main__14"/> also saw a change in her—She was thinner <lb n="c57-0140__main__15"/> and had lost much of that heavenly viva<lb n="c57-0140__main__16"/>city that had before charmed me– <lb n="c57-0140__main__17"/> But her softness & gentle looks of com<lb n="c57-0140__main__18"/>passion made her more fit for one <lb n="c57-0140__main__19"/> blasted & miserable as I was.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0140__main__20"/> The calm <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26439"/>hower<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26439"/> however which <lb n="c57-0140__main__21"/> I now enjoyed did not last. Recollection <lb n="c57-0140__main__22"/> brought madness with it– And when <lb n="c57-0140__main__23"/> I thought of what had passed a realinsani<lb n="c57-0140__main__24"/>ty possessed me – Sometimes I was furious <lb n="c57-0140__main__25"/>& burnt with rage sometimes low &des<lb n="c57-0140__main__26"/>pondant I neither spoke or looked <lb n="c57-0140__main__27"/> but sat motionless bewildered by the <lb n="c57-0140__main__28"/> multitude of miseries that overcame <lb n="c57-0140__main__29"/> me. Elizabeth alone had the power <lb n="c57-0140__main__30"/> to draw me from these fits – Her gentle <lb n="c57-0140__main__31"/> voice would sooth <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26478"/>m<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26478"/> when passionate <lb n="c57-0140__main__32"/> and inspire with <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0140__main__d3e26483"/>earthly<del eID="c57-0140__main__d3e26483"/> human fee<lb n="c57-0140__main__33"/>lings when sunk in torpor – She wept<lb n="c57-0141__main__1"/> with me and for me. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26502"/>When unhappy &<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26502"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__2"/> When reason returned she would remonstrate <lb n="c57-0141__main__3"/> with me & endeavour to inspire me with <lb n="c57-0141__main__4"/> resignation —Ah it is well for the unfortunate <lb n="c57-0141__main__5"/> to be resigned– But <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26514"/>th<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26514"/> for the guilty there is <lb n="c57-0141__main__6"/> no peace: <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26519"/>& tranquillity &<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26519"/> the agonies of <lb n="c57-0141__main__7"/> remorse poison the luxury there other<lb n="c57-0141__main__8"/>wise is <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>sometimes found in indulging <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel/> the excess of grief.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__9"/> Soon after my arrival my father <lb n="c57-0141__main__10"/> spoke of my immediate marriage with <lb n="c57-0141__main__11"/> my cousin. I remained silent.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__12"/> Have you then, said my father <lb n="c57-0141__main__13"/> some other attachment<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__14"/> None on earth <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26578"/>I replied<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26578"/> I love Eliza<lb n="c57-0141__main__15"/>beth and look forward to our union <lb n="c57-0141__main__16"/> with delight—Let the day therefore be <lb n="c57-0141__main__17"/> named and I shall be happy when it <lb n="c57-0141__main__18"/> arrives and on it I will consecrate <lb n="c57-0141__main__19"/> my life or death to the happiness <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26600"/>to<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26600"/> of <lb n="c57-0141__main__20"/> my cousin.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__21"/> My dear Victor, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26610"/>said my father,<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26610"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__22"/> do not speak thus. Heavy misfortunes <lb n="c57-0141__main__23"/> have befallen us but let <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0141__main__d3e26618"/>us<del eID="c57-0141__main__d3e26618"/> us only <lb
